review.title: Use of semantic technologies for the development of a dynamic trajectories generator in a Semantic Chemistry eLearning platform
review.abstract: ChemgaPedia is a multimedia, webbased eLearning service platform that currently contains about 18.000 pages organized in 1.700 chapters covering the complete bachelor studies in chemistry and related topics of chemistry, pharmacy, and life sciences. The eLearning encyclopedia contains some 25.000 media objects and the eLearning platform provides services such as virtual and remote labs for experiments. With up to 350.000 users per month the platform is the most frequently used scientific educational service in the German spoken Internet. In this demo we show the benefit of mapping the static eLearning contents of ChemgaPedia to a Linked Data representation for Semantic Chemistry which allows for generating dynamic eLearning paths tailored to the semantic profiles of the users.

metadata.title: Use of semantic technologies for the development of a dynamic trajectories generator in a Semantic Chemistry eLearning platform

sections.text: The eLearning Encyclopaedia comprises around 25,000 media objects and the eLearning platform offers services such as virtual and remote laboratories for experiments. With up to 350,000 users per month, the platform is the most widely used scientific education service on the German-speaking Internet. In this demo, we show the benefit of mapping ChemgaPedia's static eLearning content to a linked data representation for semantic chemistry, which makes it possible to generate dynamic eLearning paths tailored to users "semantic profiles.

sections.heading: INTRODUCTION
sections.text: Learning is a very arduous and individual process for each and every user of an eLearning environment. Particularly inexperienced learners need either a human teacher / tutor or a very intelligent, personalized artificial intelligence of the eLearning environment to be guided by an individual learning process and learning path. Even for experienced learners, a person's learning process can be optimized through personalized didactics, dynamic assembly of pages and units, and in a strong way through an appropriate and unique learning path. In order to differentiate the results of personalized, individual didactics, page content composition, and path generation from traditional eLearning content, we call the dynamically generated, individual learning paths "dynamic eLearning Trajectories" (DeLTs). In order to increase the acceptance of an education platform, this device should be able to provide user data.

sections.heading: STATE OF THE ART
sections.text: The established eLearning platform ChemgaPedia (http: / / www.chemgapedia.de) comprises approximately 18,000 websites organized into approximately 1,700 chapters. Fig. 2 shows a screenshot of the current version. The educational content is designed for higher education in chemistry, pharmacy, biochemistry and related sciences. Target groups are teachers, students, experienced students and apprentices. Due to the high content quality of the platform, the most commonly used students, teachers and apprentices rely on the constant availability of platform and content. Content within the platform consists of text and multimedia elements such as animations, applications and videos. Course paths and the provision of pages and units are statically created by domain experts. Authors are responsible for the creation of content and the associated chapters and pages. Content is presented in XML format that specializes in a schema that represents eLearning content. All pages and media elements are stored in an XL database.

sections.heading: STRATEGY
sections.text: The goal of the collaboration between FIZ and CHEMIE is to develop an ontological copy of the current Chinese platform. To this end, we are currently developing two ontologies: a chemical ontology and an eLearning platform. In contrast to the existing ontologies, we are using the expertise of the authors of Chinese that are suitable for use in the eLearning platform.

sections.heading: CONCLUSION
sections.text: ChemgaPedia is a scientific education service on the German-speaking Internet, which is publicly accessible without registration. Currently, all content and especially the educational paths are statically created by domain experts. In this article, we have presented the first steps towards an ontology-based eLearning platform that will be able to dynamically generate educational paths according to user interest.1 http: / / www.ebi.ac.uk / chebi / 2 http: / / bio2rdf.org / 3 http: / en.dbpedia.org /
